citation.article-title: Nocardioides fonticola sp. nov., a novel actinomycete isolated from spring water.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardioides fonticola sp. nov.

Nocardioides fonticola [fon.ti.co′la. L. masc. n. fons, fontis a spring, fountain; L. suff. -cola (from L. masc. or fem. n. incola) an inhabitant of a place, a resident; N.L. n. fonticola an inhabitant of a fountain or spring].
Gram-positive and strictly aerobic.
Oxidase-negative, catalase-positive and non-acid-fast.
No endospore formation.
Cells are non-motile rods, approximately 0.8 μm wide and 2.0–9.0 μm long.
Substrate or aerial mycelium is not observed.
Colonies on R2A are pale yellowish in colour, circular and convex with entire edges.
Colonies are approximately 0.9–1.0 mm in diameter after 3 days (on R2A at 25 °C) of incubation and reach a maximum of 2 mm after 5 days of growth.
Growth occurs at 0.5–1.0 % (w/v) NaCl, pH 5–9 and 25–37 °C, with optimum growth at 0.5 % (w/v) NaCl, pH 7–8 and 30 °C.
Starch, skimmed milk, and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed.
DNase-positive and lipase (corn oil)-negative.
The following characters are positive (API 20NE test) for the type strain: aesculin hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis, β-galactosidase and assimilation of glucose and mannitol.

Negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, glucose fermentation, arginine dihydrolase, urease, and assimilation of N-acetylglucosamine, gluconate, malate, caprate, adipate, citrate and phenylacetate.

Strain NAA-13T is positive (API ZYM test) for alkaline phosphatase, C4 esterase, C8 lipase, leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase and β-glucosidase, but is negative for C14 lipase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.

Positive (API Coryne test) for pyrazinamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, alkaline phosphatase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, and aesculin and gelatin hydrolysis, but negative for nitrate reduction, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, urease, and acid production from d-glucose, d-xylose, d-mannitol, maltose, d-lactose, sucrose, d-ribose and glycogen.

Resistant to nalidixic acid, ceftizoxime and sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim antibiotics and sensitive to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, gentamicin, kanamycin, novobiocin, rifampicin, penicillin G, streptomycin and tetracycline.
Major menaquinone is MK-8(H4).
Cell wall diamino acid is ll-DAP.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 71.8 mol%.
The type strain, NAA-13T (=LMG 24213T=BCRC 16874T), was isolated from spring water, southern Taiwan.
